comms: Nominal constructions with kata systematically correspond to the use of ablatives with pronouns (cf. дара-л лес-тар [бояться-PRS.3SG он-ABL].
In this meaning, the verb always has the 3SG form.
comms_internal: совпадает с достичь, но в любом случае, похоже, другая модель

comms: The preposition is obligatory with pronouns. With nominal Y’s the transitive construction is possible.
comms_internal: Был еще вариант с биноминативной конструкцией

comms: Neutralization of case is possible.
Is this a typo? I would expect пе as the preposition.
Does this really mean: entered MY house?

comms: Neutralization of case is impossible.
There is no inherited equivalent. The verb used is a Russian loanword.
Alternative is страндил with the same pattern.
The use of the preposition жи is optional. With a nominal Y argument, the structure with the preposition(s) жи ка would be used: арэс-л-о жи ка берег-о [до к берег-DIR.SG].

comms: Alternative is амисавел + LOC. Was the choice correct?

comms: There is no inherited equivalent. The verb used is a Russian loanword.
Non-reflexive verb is possible when the second argument is a complement clause: ме гындив, кэ арэсав кхэрэ кал рром ‘я думаю, что доеду домой к цыганам’

comms: There is no inherited equivalent. The verb used is a Russian loanword.

comms: With a pronominal Y argument, the structure with the ablative case (ABL) would be used.
This is literally ‘to laugh’. With a pronominal Y argument, the structure with the ablative case (ABL) would be used. Alternative is прасал ‘дразнить’, which is used in the transitive construction.
comms_internal: Были два варианта, ожин скорее дразнить (прасал, переходный), другой скорее смеяться над (асал, НОМ-АБЛ), решил оба не брать

comms: Alternative is ашел ‘оставаться’, used with the NOM_biGEN pattern (literally, ‘remain without the house’).

comms: No satisfactory translation has been obtained.

comms: Alternative is the transitive construction with the same verb. Interestingly, the consultant also accepted the use of an oblique stem with an inanimate noun.

comms: Alternative is анел, used with the same transitive pattern.

There is no inherited equivalent. The verb used is a Russian loanword. NB: the pattern was written as NOM_pe. However, in the example itself the preposition looks like “po”. Is this a type? A different preposition? Or just a contextual variant?

comms: The pattern was initially identified as NOM_pa. However, NOM_pala is also possible. In fact, some verbs are currently identified as NOM_pa and other verbs, as NOM_pala. Does this distinction reflect anything? Should is be abandoned? One more alternative is скучаил (a Russian loanword), used with the NOM_pa or NOM_pala pattern.
sentence: ле Мурш-аc л-е-л доро па Марийк-а

comms: With a pronominal Y argument, the NOM_paLOC structure would be used.

То же, что дотронуться, но другое управление

comms: With a pronominal Y argument, the NOM_peLOC structure would be used. The pattern is identified here as NOM_pe, however, the example contains “po”. Is this correct? comms: Alternative is марэл + OBL, used in the transitive construction.

НЕсмотря даже на то, что сам Кирилл "голосовал" бы за тот другой глагол (марэл), потому что этот, который я беру, всегда выражает однокртаное действие. а тот переводит более точно. Но для меня однократность не страшна тут
